intro: Arthrostemma lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arthrostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
